explains: adv. 稍微，略微地；轻微地，很少地；边缘地；在页边；最低限度地

sentences.en: Indeed, the fourth generation is marginally worse off than the third.
sentences.cn: 事实上，第四代比第三代过得稍微差一些。

sentences.en: Sales last year were marginally higher than in 1991.
sentences.cn: 去年的销售量比1991年略微高一点。

sentences.en: They now cost marginally more than they did last year.
sentences.cn: 他们现在并不比去年贵多少。
